3.8.21  4:01 pm   do a face reveal

      that's preposterous. who do you think i am

3.8.21  3:54 pm   what is the best currency?

      time

3.8.21  3:28 pm   do we have free will?

      yes

3.8.21  1:50 pm   Were you good at writing assignments in school? Because I'm always too horrified to do them; like everybody just does them as if it's the same as putting together cars on an assembly line but I can't think of the assignments like that, like I can't write something unless I'm sure it's true and meaningful. I guess ideally, I should be able to do that in a timely manner but I just can't, or at least I'm too scared to try. And the classic advice I always get is to not care too much about writing something good, but it just hurts to meaninglessly write for the sake of writing, like what's the point of being a human if you can't create anything with significance? Also it's not like the work that everyone else produces is shitty, it's actually very good which means that if I take the assembly-line approach, not only will the act of it feel horrible, but its product will be worse than what everyone else is somehow able to create with the same method. I dunno, I guess I'm asking this because you're definitely someone who makes meaningful content and well, you normally turn it out on a regular basis, so maybe you have some advice on how to accomplish this and perhaps on how you were able to these assignments back when you were in school. Thanks for reading this, I'm sorry if most of it is just a rant.

      clearly you are a writer, as seen above. I think it's worth looking into re-negotiating your contract with your producer (the one giving you the assignments). Make sure you both understand each other's goals in this, and then evaluate if you would both like to keep working with each other

3.8.21  11:05 am    What makes someone a person?

      each person makes themself a person. But, in case they don't, any other person is also available to step in and make that person a person. Although this is not usually necessary. person is usually able to make self person

3.8.21  10:29 am   What's the freshest form of entertainment?

      the morning sun

3.8.21  9:54 am   i play guitar and it feels like it doesn't like me unless i play things that someone else made; i can never make a good chord progression, and when i do, i never have good words to pair with them. whenever i make lyrics, i find that they sound too much like other people's lyrics and i get mad at myself, crumple up the computer paper i was working with, and throw it away and go to bed. any tips?

      you mentioned you were starting with chords then putting words to them. How about starting with words (AND a melody), then putting chords with that? But, you also mentioned that you don't feel too great with words yet. So for that, i would recommend opening up a text file and just start going bonkers day and night, not to write songs, but just do it as a way of life, until further notice. Really try to use the page to actually solve any problems in life you may have. after a couple years of doing that, i think you will find words to be quite a good playground to be on. Then if you decide to add music into that, then you'll be so powerful it's unfair

3.8.21  9:45 am   how long does it take for you to make one of your music videos?

      a reasonable amount of time

3.8.21  9:29 am   how long is your piano

      about 38 inches

3.8.21  9:21 am   how to build a chair?

      Remove all parts from the carton and separate them into part number groups as indicated in the parts list. To begin assembly, place the 5-star base upside down and insert casters into the bottom of base. Turn the base right side up on the floor and insert the cylinder into the center hole on the base. Place the telescoping cover over the the cylinder and rest it on the base. Attach the seat plate to the bottom of the seat cushion (with front of seat plate facing the front of the seat cushion) by using 15/8" screws into the front holes of the seat plate and 7/8" screws into the rear holes of the seat plate and tighten the screws. Align the back cushion with the seat cushion by positioning the back support plate over the seat plate with 11/4" screws. Do not tighten the screws completely. Attach the arms respectively on each side onto the bottom of the seat cushion and the sides of back cushion by using 11/2" screws. Tighten all the screws. Remember to tighten the screws on the back support plate. Place the plastic caps into the two arm holes on each arm. Place the assembled chair on top of the cylinder and press down until fully engaged. Periodically (every 90 days) make sure that the screws are still fully tightened.

3.7.21  11:10 am   Why is the "Bill Wurtz capital letter usage report" even a thing? Trying to read the whole paragraph gives me a stroke and there are some places which have over 30 exclamation points. I'm dying at attempting to read the whole thing, this is absurd but funny at the same time.

      that last part you said, that is part of the reason for its existence, and, speaking of 'absurd and funny', the other reason for its existense is that i think it's absurd and funny when people think i don't use capital letters, because i use them all the time, right on this page, and even more in my videos

It's a nearly perfect chair, it's completely comfortable, there is a heavenly experience in sitting in it, it fits everyone, there are no unintended curves or rough edges, it is very beautiful and would not look out of place in a castle or in a bus, its only flaw being that it degrades as it gets used. Should people sit in the chair?
